intro: Hieracium vegaradanum, commonly known as the western meadowhawk, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its yellow-orange flowers and hairy stems, which are typical features of many hawkweeds. The plant is native to the mountainous regions of Europe and is often found in meadows and grasslands. It produces small, elongated leaves that are usually arranged in a basal rosette. Hieracium vegaradanum is known for its ability to thrive in nutrient-poor soils, making it a common sight in alpine environments.
